properties.value: Unlike most skills, which start at level 1, Agility starts at level 15. This is to allow for training through Barbarian Fishing, as soon as the other skill requirements are met. The lowest level barbarian fish, the leaping trout, requires level 15 Agility, level 15 Strength, and level 48 Fishing to catch. A barbarian rod can be bought from Tynan, and its wieldable version, the pearl barbarian rod, can be bought from Alry the Angler's Angling Accessories.

Training[edit | edit source]

15+ : Barbarian Fishing[edit | edit source]

A player using tick manipulation to quickly train through Barbarian Fishing.
Main article: Barbarian Fishing

Unlike most skills, which start at level 1, Agility starts at level 15. This is to allow for training through Barbarian Fishing, as soon as the other skill requirements are met. The lowest level barbarian fish, the leaping trout, requires level 15 Agility, level 15 Strength, and level 48 Fishing to catch. A barbarian rod can be bought from Tynan, and its wieldable version, the pearl barbarian rod, can be bought from Alry the Angler's Angling Accessories.

While most of the experience gained through this activity is Fishing experience, it also provides a small amount of Agility and Strength experience as well. For every 100,000 Fishing experience gained through Barbarian Fishing, the player should expect around 9,000 Agility and Strength experience as well. This means that if a player reaches level 99 Fishing solely through Barbarian Fishing, they would gain more than one million Agility experience along the way, enough to reach about level 74 Agility.

60+ : Wintertodt Pillars[edit | edit source]

From level 60 Agility onwards, it is possible to train Agility by repeatedly using the gap-jump shortcut in the Wintertodt's prison. Each jump gives 90 experience, making it a good way to get a bit of Agility experience while waiting for the Wintertodt to spawn. If focusing solely on training Agility here, the player can expect experience rates of up to 150,000 Agility experience per hour. Keep in mind that the Wintertodt is a dangerous boss, so it is recommended to bring multiple pieces of warm clothing and sufficient food.

List of Shortcuts[edit | edit source]

Below is a list of shortcuts available within Great Kourend and the Kebos Lowlands:

Level(s) Icon Obstacle Location Notes XP
28 Pillar jump North-west corner of the Catacombs of Kourend Allows quicker access between brutal red dragons and steel dragons. Each pillar has to be individually clicked to jump across. 10
29 Rocks Lower Mount Karuulm cliffside climb Allows slightly quicker access to the volcano's summit. 0
40 Stepping stones Kourend lake isle jump Located south-east of the Infirmary and west of Watson's house. Allows easier travel to Shayzien and Hosidius. 0
45 Stepping stones Kourend river jump Located west of the Kourend Player-owned house portal, this allows easier travel over the Great Kourend river in Hosidius. 0
49 Boulder Dense essence mine boulder leap Provides a one-way shortcut to quickly return to the mine via the Soul Altar. 0
52 Rock climb Dense essence mine eastern scramble Shortcut on the eastern side of the dense essence mine 0
60 Gap Pillars in the Wintertodt's Prison Requires level 50 Firemaking. 90
62 Rocks Upper Mount Karuulm cliffside climb Allows quicker access to the volcano's summit. 0
69 Rock climb Dense essence mine northern scramble Shortcut on the north side of the dense essence mine 0
73 Rock climb Dense essence mine western descent Provides a one-way shortcut to quickly return to the mine via the Blood Altar. 0
75 Spiked blades Forthos Dungeon jump Leads to the red dragons. Failing this jump will cause 1-5 damage. 50 (25 on fail)
88 Mysterious pipe Karuulm Slayer Dungeon Allows players to reach the Alchemical Hydra lair safely. 0

{{Twisted League Guide Links}}

==Training==
===15+ : Barbarian Fishing===
[[File:Tick manipulation - cut-eat Fishing.gif|thumb|A player using tick manipulation to quickly train through Barbarian Fishing.]]
{{Main|Barbarian Fishing}}
Unlike most skills, which start at level 1, Agility starts at level 15. This is to allow for training through [[Barbarian Fishing]], as soon as the other skill requirements are met. The lowest level barbarian fish, the [[leaping trout]], requires level 15 Agility, level 15 [[Strength]], and level 48 [[Fishing]] to catch. A [[barbarian rod]] can be bought from [[Tynan]], and its wieldable version, the [[pearl barbarian rod]], can be bought from [[Alry the Angler's Angling Accessories]].

While most of the experience gained through this activity is Fishing experience, it also provides a small amount of Agility and Strength experience as well. For every 100,000 Fishing experience gained through Barbarian Fishing, the player should expect around 9,000 Agility and Strength experience as well. This means that if a player reaches level 99 Fishing solely through Barbarian Fishing, they would gain more than one million Agility experience along the way, enough to reach about level 74 Agility.

===60+ : Wintertodt Pillars===
From level 60 Agility onwards, it is possible to train Agility by repeatedly using the gap-jump shortcut in the [[Wintertodt]]'s prison. Each jump gives 90 experience, making it a good way to get a bit of Agility experience while waiting for the Wintertodt to spawn. If focusing solely on training Agility here, the player can expect experience rates of up to 150,000 Agility experience per hour. Keep in mind that the Wintertodt is a dangerous boss, so it is recommended to bring multiple pieces of [[Wintertodt/Warm clothing|warm clothing]] and sufficient food.

==List of Shortcuts==
Below is a list of shortcuts available within [[Great Kourend]] and the [[Kebos Lowlands]]:
